LinkItem.internal_link_text: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template
How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template

pre.code: <!-- Define a test method with metadata: --> <method name="PlugAndPlaySurpriseRemoveTest"> <!-- Required properties for ERT--> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Drivers" value="TRUE"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter" value="DQ"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description" value="A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s) - http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=232678"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Parameter.DQ.Default" value="INF::OriginalInfFileName='%InfFileName%'"/> <TestMethodProperty name="RebootPossible" value="true" /> <!-- TODO: Properties to be customized to match your test requirements --> <TestMethodProperty name="Description" value="Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test"/> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Category" value="My Test Category"/> <!-- Optional properties for ERT--> <TestMethodProperty name="Kits.Drivers.ResultFile" value="TestTextLog.log"/> <!-- (see Windows Driver Kit documentation for additional optional properties) --> </method>
[Script] < TestProperty name="Description" value= "This test cycles the system through various sleep states and performs IO on devices before and after each sleep state cycle"/>

[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Description", L"Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template")

[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="Sleep with IO Before and After"/>

[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.DisplayName", L"My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test")

[Script]
< TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Description" value="Test mode parameter: Logo or Simple"/>

[C++]
TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description", L"A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s)")
